Table of Contents

Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Enums

Enums

ArticleStatus

Represents the user-facing status of an individual article within the RSS/Atom reader application.

FeedHealthStatus

Represents the health and operational status of an RSS/Atom feed, determined by the outcome of recent update/fetch attempts and overall accessibility.

FeedUpdateFrequency

Defines the refresh interval options for automatic background polling of RSS/Atom feeds.

LogicalOperator

Specifies the logical operator used to combine multiple conditions or filters in queries, rules, or search expressions within the RSS reader application.

ModuleStatus

Module status enumeration.

NotificationAction

Represents the different types of user interactions or resolutions applied to a notification generated by the RSS reader application (new articles, feed errors, sync events, etc.).

NotificationPriority

Defines the urgency level and presentation behavior of notifications in the RSS reader application.

NotificationType

Specifies the delivery/presentation method for notifications in the RSS reader application.

RuleActionType

Defines the possible automated actions that can be executed when an article matches the conditions of a user-defined rule or filter in the RSS reader application.

RuleFieldTarget

Specifies the target field(s) of an article where a rule condition (e.g., keyword match, pattern search, or value comparison) is evaluated in the RSS reader's rule/filter engine.

RuleOperator

Defines the comparison operators available for evaluating conditions in the RSS reader's rule/filter engine.

RuleScope

Defines the scope of application for a user-defined rule or filter in the RSS reader. The scope determines which feeds or articles the rule conditions and actions are evaluated against.

SyncPriority

Priority levels for task scheduling.

SyncStatus

Represents the overall synchronization status.

SyncTaskStatus

Status of an individual synchronization task.

SyncTaskType

Types of synchronization tasks managed by the coordinator.
